revised_title: Determination of Absolute Values, Secular Change, and Annual Variation of the Magnetic Force in British Colonial Observatories
tldr: The author, Edward Sabine, discusses the methods used in British Colonial Magnetic Observatories to determine the absolute values, secular change, and annual variation of the magnetic force. He presents findings from Toronto and Hobarton, showing that the magnetic needle approaches the vertical position more in the winter months at both locations, and the total force is greatest from October to February and least from April to August.
